CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 13, 1945, pg. 5, reads: "Getting Ready for 'Million Dollar' Horse Show - William Geary, who is in charge of arrangements and construction for the coming horse show at Hunt Armory, spreads the first shovel full of dirt on the spacious Hunt Armory floor. More than 150 truckloads of dirt was necessary to cover the cement floor for the 'dancin' steeds to prance on next Thursday, Friday and Saturday.  Watching him perform the ceremony is, left to right: James Barr, director of the city's lands and buildings department; B. A. Blumberger, a member of the show's ring committee; Wes Geary, also a member of the ring committee; Sam Linetsky, who will enter a number of horses; William Geary and W. J. Parish, operating manager of the Allegheny Asphalt and Paving company, who is supplying the dirt. - Courier Photo by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Wes Geary wearing striped suit and golashes, holding reins of two horses, in Hunt Armory
